titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David Westheimer literary papers, 1940-1997 MS 345

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 21:31:41 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: Contains materials relating to Westheimer's literary work, including manuscripts, typescripts, drafts, reviews, research, and correspondence

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: David Westheimer (April 11, 1917-November 8, 2005) was born in Houston, Texas and graduated from Rice University in 1937. He left his career as a journalist for the Houston Post to join the U.S. Army Air Forces after the United States entered World War II. He became a prisoner of war (P.O.W.) after his B-24 bomber was shot down near Italy, He used this experience to shape one of his best known literary works Von Ryan's Express, which was published in 1964 and went on to become a bestseller and a film starring Frank Sinatra. Besides writing novels such as My Sweet Charlie(1965), Westheimer also wrote television screenplays (often based on his work) and his autobiography: Sitting It Out: A World War II POW Memoir(1992). He returned to the Houston Post as a columnist in the 1980s and died of heart failure in Los Angeles in 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscripts and multiple drafts with marked revisions of Westheimer's novels as well as teleplays and scripts for his television work. Also included are Houston Post newspaper columns, research, photos, and related correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by David Westheimer in 2003. An addendum was donated by Fred Westheimer (son of David Westheimer) in 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: David Westheimer Literary Papers, 1940-1997, MS 345, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the David Westhemier literary papers must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.
